decks.notes: The main focus of this Mono Blue Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with low-cost creatures like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with counterspells like Counterspell and Spell Pierce. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to ensure card advantage and consistency. Sleep of the Dead is included for control and tempo advantage, while cards like Boomerang provide additional disruption. The overall strategy is to apply pressure, control the game tempo, and ultimately outpace the opponent to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with small, efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cheap and efficient counterspells, card draw, and card selection, the deck aims to maintain control of the game while pressuring the opponent with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent. The inclusion of bounce spells like Sleep of the Dead and Tolarian Terror adds to the overall tempo and disruption that the deck is looking to achieve in order to come out on top in 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to maximize mana production and efficiently play aggressive creatures to apply pressure on the opponent. By using cards like Wild Growth and Utopia Sprawl to accelerate mana development, this deck aims to quickly bring out threats like Avenging Hunter and Nyxborn Hydra to overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, cards like Ram Through and Malevolent Rumble provide removal options to clear the way for powerful attacks. Overall, this deck focuses on early board presence and tempo to gain an advantage and secure a victory.

The focus of this deck is to quickly build a board presence with cheap, aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Counterspell and Spell Pierce. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Ponder, Thought Scour, and Brainstorm to ensure consistency and maintain pressure on the opponent. Additionally, Sleep of the Dead provides a potential win condition by tapping down the opponent's creatures.

The main focus of this Golgari/Jund Garden deck is to control the board using a combination of removal spells like Cast Down and Defile, along with creatures like Crypt Rats and Troll of Khazad-dûm. The deck also includes cards like Avenging Hunter and Thorn of the Black Rose to generate card advantage. Additionally, the deck has some life gain and graveyard hate with cards like Lembas and Nihil Spellbomb. The overall strategy is to outvalue the opponent with efficient removal and resilient threats while disrupting their game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a board of low-cost creatures and utilizing sacrifice effects to keep the pressure on the opponent. By sacrificing creatures to pump up Bloodthrone Vampire and Mortician Beetle, as well as triggering abilities like Infestation Sage and Nested Shambler, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless aggression. The inclusion of cards like Village Rites and Rite of Consumption helps to draw cards and finish off the opponent, while removal spells like Tragic Slip and creature recursion with Unearth provide additional versatility and staying power.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats and finish the game before they have a chance to stabilize. By utilizing a mix of creatures and direct damage spells, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and force the opponent on the defensive, ultimately securing victory through sheer aggression and speed.

This deck focuses on utilizing defenders with high toughness to generate a large amount of mana, allowing for explosive plays and combos. By ramping up quickly with cards like Axebane Guardian and Overgrown Battlement, the deck aims to cast powerful spells such as Freed from the Real or Valakut Invoker to overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Winding Way and Lead the Stampede helps to maintain card advantage, while Beastrider Vanguard and Galvanic Alchemist provide additional combo potential. The deck thrives on generating massive amounts of mana to execute its game-winning combos efficiently.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing creatures with value-generating abilities like Archaeomancer and Mulldrifter, along with spells like Ephemerate and Snap to disrupt opponents. The deck also includes card draw options like Mulldrifter and Meeting of Minds to ensure consistency. The inclusion of Sunscape Familiar helps reduce the cost of spells, while cards like Negate and Prohibit provide additional control options. Overall, this deck aims to outvalue opponents and control the pace of the game to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of Gates and spells to stay ahead of the opponent. By using cards like Counterspell and Prismatic Strands to disrupt the opponent's strategy, along with creature removal like Journey to Nowhere, the deck aims to maintain board control. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Squadron Hawk and Lórien Revealed helps to provide card advantage and maintain consistency throughout the game. The goal is to outlast the opponent and secure a victory through careful planning and strategic decision-making.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw to maintain board control. The deck utilizes Gates to help fix mana and provide additional card advantage. The win condition is through attacking with a few key creatures and using removal spells to clear the way. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind them out of resources until victory is achieved.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and utilizing affinity mechanics to reduce their costs. By combining aggression with efficient mana usage, it aims to overwhelm the opponent with a wide board presence and direct damage spells. The deck also includes cards for card draw and graveyard hate to disrupt opponent strategies. The mana base is designed to support the artifact-heavy deck with minimal color requirements.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficiently use burn spells to deal damage. By combining low-cost creatures like Guttersnipe and Sneaky Snacker with instant damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast, this deck aims to keep the pressure on the opponent from the start of the game. Additionally, cards like Faithless Looting and Grab the Prize help to ensure that the deck maintains a steady flow of threats and answers. Overall, the deck focuses on a fast and relentless approach to defeat the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy involves playing low-cost creatures like Sneaky Snacker and Voldaren Epicure to chip away at the opponent's life total, while also using burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast to finish them off. Guttersnipe and Kessig Flamebreather provide additional damage each time a spell is cast. The deck also includes cards like Faithless Looting and Grab the Prize for card draw and Highway Robbery for extra mana ramp.

The main focus of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to quickly swarm the board with low-cost creatures while using sacrifice and graveyard effects to continually buff and strengthen your creatures. By sacrificing creatures and utilizing cards like Village Rites and Mortician Beetle, you can easily overwhelm your opponent and deal quick and heavy damage. The deck also includes cards like Supernatural Stamina and Rite of Consumption to add additional instant burst damage to finish off your opponent. This aggressive strategy aims to win the game quickly and decisively before your opponent can establish their own board presence.

The main focus of this Aggro - Red Deck Wins Pauper 1 vs 1 deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures and burn spells. By efficiently using cards like Burning-Tree Emissary and Goblin Bushwhacker to quickly build a board presence, along with powerful burn spells like Galvanic Blast and Lightning Bolt, this deck aims to finish the game as quickly as possible. The inclusion of cards like Rally at the Hornburg and Wrenn's Resolve provide additional support and ways to push through for lethal damage. With a strong mana base and efficient creatures, this deck looks to outpace and overpower the opponent.
